It covers practices like connecting to MCP servers, retrieving and adapting tool specifications, and executing them using defined interactions. This guide is invaluable for developers transitioning from frameworks such as Semantic Kernel, AutoGen, or LangChain, seeking to explore interoperability and advanced tool usage.

dotnet.name: GettingStarted_documentation
dotnet.description: This documentation provides a comprehensive guide to utilizing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with the Agent Framework, focusing on secure communication with an MCP Server using OAuth 2.0 authentication. It details the setup, configuration, and execution of integration processes, specifically demonstrating how to leverage MCP tools within the agent ecosystem. Developers transitioning from frameworks like AutoGen, Semantic Kernel, or LangChain will find this guide useful for implementing standardized context protocols in their workflow.

dotnet.name: GettingStarted_documentation
dotnet.description: This guide introduces developers to configuring and setting up an Agent Framework project using Azure Foundry services, covering initial system requirements and environment configuration. It is targeted at users familiar with frameworks like Semantic Kernel or LangChain, showcasing migration pathways to integrate similar features within this setup.

dotnet.name: GettingStarted_documentation
dotnet.description: This documentation provides an introductory guide to building and executing declarative workflows using the Agent Framework, with a focus on utilizing Azure Foundry resources. It is especially useful for developers transitioning from other frameworks such as Semantic Kernel or LangChain, looking to grasp the foundational setup and execution patterns.

dotnet.name: GettingStarted_documentation
dotnet.description: This sample illustrates methods for visualizing workflows in different formats, such as Mermaid and Graphviz. This facilitates comprehension of fan-out/fan-in patterns in the Workflow model, crucial for developers transitioning from other frameworks like LangChain or Semantic Kernel.

dotnet.name: GettingStarted_documentation
dotnet.description: This documentation outlines how to combine AI agents and custom executors effectively in workflows, leveraging advanced concepts such as the adapter pattern, chat protocol requirements, and agent-executor integration. This guide is particularly beneficial for developers seeking to understand and migrate robust, mixed-component workflows in their systems using the Agent Framework.
